intro: Spigelia nervosa, commonly known as the slender spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, red-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spigelia nervosa is often found in sandy or loamy soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
